properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 2 at 4:32PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
The combination of strong winds and fresh snow cover is resulting
in areas of blowing snow across the area. These conditions will
likely persist through tonight and Tuesday.

* WHAT...Blowing and drifting snow along with winds of 25 to 35
mph and gusts of 40 to occasionally 50 mph.

* WHERE...Primarily along Highway 28 over South Pass.

* WHEN...Now through most of Tuesday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...If out driving on area highways during this
time frame, anticipate rapidly fluctuating visibility due to
blowing and drifting snow. The visibility will briefly drop to
near zero at times in some areas. Slick, icy roads will also be
in place, where the blowing snow is occurring.

NWSheadline: Strong winds and blowing snow for the rest of this afternoon, through Tuesday
